column4: aha! ok: the xsane refuses to run unless I am "root". If I run it as "root" it says -- no! don't run me as root -- it's dangerous. What should I do?
whats the error when you run as non root?
no devices available. I have a USB HP scanjet 2200c. When run as root it works all right.
and how do I permit all users to use the scanner?
aha! this helped: chmod -R 666 /proc/bus/usb/; chmod go+x /proc/bus/usb/. Thanks a lot!
you'll need to put it in ur /etc/fstab to make the changes permanent after restart
aha, /etc/fstab runs automatically at the startup?
it mounts ur filesystems on startup with the relevant permissions etc
ok, I'll do that, thanks a lot!
